required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Hemodynamic and Biological Effects of ECP and Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Cardiovascular Effects of External Counterpulsation (ECP) in Comparison With Physical Exercise in Healthy Individuals

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study in humans with stable coronary artery disease (CAD) treatable by percutaneous intervention (PCI) is to evaluate the efficacy of Enhanced External Counterpulsation (EECP) with regard to coronary collateral growth.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic

primary_outcome.measure: Myocardial Blood Flow (MBF) measurement by Myocardial Contrast Echocardiography (MCE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: During ECP respectively Bicycle Exercise, expected to be on average 90 minutes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline & post intervention, expected to be on average 90 minutes

clinical_study.condition: Patients With Stable Coronary Artery Disease

arm_group.description: 60 minutes of half supine bicycle exercise with submaximal workload

intervention.description: by MCE, PWA, Doppler, Multiplex, FACS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age > 18 years, written informed consent to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1. Pregnancy (serum Î²-HCG<2 IU/l for all female volunteers)
Baseline History:
1. Endurance exercise 5 days before and the days between the exams
2. History of cardiovascular disease or surgery, including arterial hypertension, Raynaud phenomenon, recurrent migraine, or any cardiac rhythm disorder
3. History of metabolic disorder, particularly diabetes mellitus
4. History of respiratory, renal, hepatic or cerebral disease
5. Allergic reactions to Luminity or its components
6. Cardiovascular medication
7. Illness characterized by acute phase response
8. Anaemia with haemoglobin levels < 110 g/L
Baseline Physical Examination:
1. Peripheral artery disease
Baseline Echocardiogram:
1. Valvular heart disease
2. Aortic aneurysm (any abnormality of ascending aorta, aortic arch or descending aorta)
3. Intra- or extracardiac shunt
4. Systolic or diastolic left ventricular (LV) dysfunction
5. LV-hypertrophy
6. Pulmonary arterial hypertension
